Article_Name: Humanitarian Crisis In Madagascar As Cyclone Kills 20, Displaces 55,000
News Info: Cyclone Batsirai swept out of Madagascar on Monday after killing 20 people, displacing 55,000 and devastating the drought-hit island's agricultural heartland, leading the UN to warn of a worsening humanitarian crisis.

Article_Name: On Rape Accused Antique Dealer's Bail Pleas, Court Seeks Kerala's View
News Info: The Kerala High Court on Monday sought the stand of the police on the bail pleas moved by controversial self-styled antiques dealer Monson Mavunkal in two separate rape cases in which he is an accused.

Article_Name: School Students In Sweden Robbed At Knifepoint In Middle Of Class
News Info: Just after lunchtime, two knife-wielding robbers wearing masks entered a classroom and forced students to hand over their computers, police and media said.

Article_Name: "Blatant Lie": Arvind Kejriwal Counters PM's Claim On Migrants' Exodus
News Info: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and the leaders of the ruling Congress and Shiv Sena in Maharashtra today vociferously protested against Prime Minister Narendra Modi's comment that they had contributed to the spread of Covid.

Article_Name: J&K Becomes First UT To Be Integrated With National Single Window System
News Info: Jammu and Kashmir has become the first Union Territory to be integrated with the national single window system as Lt Governor Manoj Sinha launched the J&K single-window portal, integrating it with the national single-window system.

Article_Name: Government Records, Kim Jong-Un's "Love Letters" Found In Trump's Resort
News Info: The US National Archives retrieved multiple boxes of records -- including "love letters" from North Korean leader Kim Jong Un -- from Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort that had been improperly removed from the White House, a report said Monday.

Article_Name: Supreme Court To Resume Physical Hearings Twice A Week As Covid Cases Dip
News Info: The Supreme Court will resume physical hearings on Wednesdays and Thursdays starting next week, the top court said today in an order citing a decline in the Covid cases.

Article_Name: 2008 Ahmedabad Serial Blasts Case Verdict Likely On Tuesday
News Info: A special court is likely to pronounce its judgement on Tuesday in the case related to the 2008 Ahmedabad serial bomb blasts that claimed 56 lives and for which nearly 80 accused were put on trial, a senior public prosecutor said on Monday.

Article_Name: Another Money-For-Government Job Racket Busted, Officials Under Scanner
News Info: Last month, the agency had booked an employee of the Ministry of Railways for allegedly swindling over Rs 45 lakhs from job aspirants assuring a porter job in the East Central Railways.

Article_Name: BJP Leaders Tell Lies, Indulge In Politics Of Accusations: Akhilesh Yadav
News Info: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday launched a scathing attack against the ruling BJP, asking the party to change its name as he alleged that its leaders tell lies, cheat people and pit them against each other.

Article_Name: 2 Coaches Of Empty Train Derail In Bihar, Delaying Services For Hours
News Info: Two coaches of an empty passenger train derailed in Bihar on Monday, affecting services in the Gaya-Dhanbad division of Eastern Railway for several hours, officials said.

Article_Name: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar's 'Aide' Face Supplementary Chargesheet
News Info: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a supplementary prosecution complaint (chargesheet) against Pinki Irani, allegedly a close aide of Sukesh Chandrashekhar, in a Rs 200 crore money laundering case.

Article_Name: Hyundai's Kashmir Tweet Row Explained In 5 Points
News Info: South Korea's Hyundai Motor is facing a blowback in India after its dealer in Pakistan posted a message supporting separatists in Kashmir.

Article_Name: On Criminalising Marital Rape, Centre Gets 2 Weeks To State Its Stand
News Info: The Delhi High Court on Monday granted two weeks to the Centre to state its stand on petitions seeking criminalisation of marital rape.

Article_Name: At Age 95, Queen Elizabeth Will Return To Normal Duties After Short Break
News Info: Queen Elizabeth, who celebrated the 70th anniversary of her accession to the British throne over the weekend, will be returning to normal duties, a Buckingham Palace source said on Monday, having been advised to take it easy by her doctors.
